alert.note: Alert for Western Pima County Including Ajo, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 18 at 2:12PM MST until August 18 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following areas, Baboquivari Mountains, Tohono O`odham Nation, Upper Santa Cruz River Valley/Altar Valley and Western Pima County. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storms could produce very heavy short duration rainfall resulting in local Flash Flooding (rapid rises) while repetitive rains over a larger area could also result in significant rises in slower responding water ways such as the Vamori Wash. - http://www.weather.gov/tadd
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Western Pima County Including Ajo, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
